holidays.name: Chocolate Cake Day
holidays.description: A sweet excuse to indulge in one of the most beloved desserts: chocolate cake! On this day, people celebrate by baking and eating chocolate cake in all its delicious forms.
holidays.origin: Chocolate Cake Day is an unofficial holiday that likely originated from the popular love for chocolate and cake, celebrating this irresistible combo.
holidays.funFact: The world's largest chocolate cake weighed over 12,770 pounds and was made in 2004!

holidays.name: International Holocaust Remembrance Day
holidays.description: A solemn day dedicated to remembering the victims of the Holocaust and promoting education to prevent future genocides.
holidays.origin: Established by the United Nations in 2005 to honor the victims of the Holocaust and to encourage tolerance and human rights education.
holidays.funFact: January 27 was chosen because it marks the liberation of Auschwitz concentration camp in 1945.

holidays.name: National Geographic Day
holidays.description: Celebrates the founding of National Geographic magazine and its contributions to science, exploration, and education.
holidays.origin: National Geographic magazine was first published on January 27, 1888, inspiring curiosity about the world since then.
